revision.text: Possibly: Polygraphy, or, Short-hand made easy to the meanest capacity : being an universal character fitted to all languages : which may be learned by this book, without the help of a master, by Aulay Macaulay. (Manchester : Printed for the author and sold at his House, in Saint Anns Square Manchester ... and sold by the Booksellers & haberdashers in London ..., July 26th, 1756). http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/15094908 Or: The new short-hand or The art of swift writing with a large specimen thereof containing the morning and evening prayers, as made use of in churches, daily throughout the year..., by Aulay Macaulay. (Manchester, Printed for A. Macaulay the author and sold at his House ... [1760?]). http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/41127769
